intro: Harpalyce speciosa, commonly known as the showy harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Harpalyce speciosa is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it an important plant in arid ecosystems.
